creditline: The Douglas J. and Victoria Galloway Holmen Endowment Fund
inscription: verso BLC in black ink: Silver / AgXMH6 / Murphy / Hanrehan / Forest
markings: verso, BC, paper sticker gallery label for Weinstein Hammons Gallery
medium: Silver on gelatin silver print, mounted on aluminum
text:
Matthew Brandt is known for experimenting with photographic processes. For AgXMH6, Brandt first made a gelatin silver print of trees at the Murphy-Hanrehan Park Reserve in Savage, Minnesota, and then coated it with several layers of chemicals and liquid metals, including  silver. The resulting reflective surface is a means for Brandt to bring viewers into the mirrored frame and share with them his own experience of being lost in a forest.
From left to right:
title: AgXMH6 (Murphy-Hanrehan Forest)
